Learning disability support If you or an adult that you care for has a learning disability we can provide information and support to help you live more independently. How do I get support? Complete an adult social care assessment and we will contact you to arrange next steps. What happens next? A social worker will contact you or your carer.  They will arrange a time to come and visit you and assess your needs. A needs assessment will help us work out if you are eligible to receive support . Types of help We may be able to help, or refer you to organisations, who can help with: Education, learning and employment. Making sure you are claiming the right benefits. Direct payments. Housing. Childcare and child protection. Court liaison. Community safety. In this section Day support Learning disability support Transport to services

Professionals: Request support for an adult You can request support online for an adult under the NHS and Community Care Act. If your concern is of a safeguarding nature you should refer to the safeguarding process for professionals . If your concern is for an assessment under the Mental Health Act you should refer to the Approved Mental Health Professional Service (AMHP) . About the adult's needs Adults with low level support needs If an adult is not eligible for support from adult social care and requires more low level support to reduce isolation, deprivation and falls, please refer to advice and guidance on remaining independent and accessing organisations in the community. Adults with difficulty managing day-to-day activities If an adult is finding it hard to manage day-to-day activities at home due to a physical, mental or sensory impairment, illness or old age, please submit a referral to Occupational Therapy (OT) . An OT assessment will help them to live more independently at home

If your son with learning disabilities is displaying challenging behavior that you can no longer manage at home in Liverpool, you can seek emergency support through Liverpool's local social care services. **Contact Liverpool City Council's adult social care services to request an assessment for your son.**

- **Request Support:** You can complete an adult social care assessment through the Liverpool City Council website. This will help determine the specific support needs and the next steps. A social worker will contact you to arrange a visit and assess your son's needs ([Document 9](https://www.liverpool.gov.uk/adult-social-care/who-we-support/community-support/learning-disability-support/)).

- **Emergency and Crisis Support:** In case of an immediate crisis, consider reaching out to the Liverpool Citizens Support Scheme, which provides help for vulnerable residents in urgent need. This includes support for essential living costs ([Document 7](https://www.liverpool.gov.uk/benefits/)).

- **Community Support Services:** Liverpool offers day support services and learning disability support, which include person-centered planning and outreach. These services can be tailored to help manage challenging behaviors ([Document 3](https://www.liverpool.gov.uk/adult-social-care/who-we-support/community-support/)).

For more detailed information and to start the process, visit the [Liverpool City Council's SEND local offer website](https://www.liverpool.gov.uk/children-and-families/special-educational-needs-and-disabilities/send-local-offer/) or contact their adult social care services directly.
